name: bacass-assembly
title: Bacterial Genome Assembly (nf-core/bacass)
description: Assemble and annotate bacterial genomes from short-read (Illumina) or long-read (Nanopore) sequencing data using the nf-core/bacass pipeline. Performs quality control, contamination checking, genome assembly with Unicycler, and annotation with Prokka for microbiology research.
content:
Bacterial Genome Assembly

The nf-core/bacass pipeline assembles and annotates bacterial genomes from sequencing data. Supports short-read (Illumina), long-read (Nanopore), and hybrid assembly approaches for comprehensive bacterial genomics.

What This Pipeline Does

  • Quality Control: FastQC and FastP for read quality assessment
  • Contamination Checking: Kraken2 to detect contamination
  • Genome Assembly: Unicycler for high-quality bacterial assemblies
  • Genome Annotation: Prokka to identify genes and features
  • Assembly QC: QUAST for assembly quality metrics
  • MultiQC Reports: Comprehensive quality summaries

Use Cases

  • Pathogen Genomics: Assemble genomes of bacterial pathogens
  • AMR Research: Identify antibiotic resistance genes
  • Outbreak Investigation: Genomic epidemiology
  • Strain Characterization: Compare bacterial isolates
  • Novel Species: De novo assembly and annotation

Input Requirements

CSV samplesheet with columns:

  • ID: Sample identifier
  • R1: Forward reads (Illumina)
  • R2: Reverse reads (Illumina, optional for single-end)
  • LongFastQ: Long reads (Nanopore, optional)
  • GenomeSize: Expected genome size (e.g., 5m for 5 megabases)

Key Outputs

  • Assembly FASTA: Assembled genome sequence
  • Annotation GFF: Gene predictions and features
  • QC Reports: Assembly statistics (N50, L50, contigs)
  • Contamination Report: Kraken2 results

Perfect for: Microbiologists • Clinical labs • Epidemiologists • AMR researchers • Bacterial geneticists
